data.name: Sample - GitHub - 1.0.0
data.description: GitHub is a code hosting platform for collaboration and version control. This connector facilitates automated interactions with Github, such as to create and manage repositories, branches, issues, pull requests, and many more.

workflows.description: Creates a new repository in the specified organization. The authenticated user must be a member of the organization.
workflows.name: Create Organization Repository

workflows.description: Lists repositories for the specified organization.
workflows.name: List Organization Repositories

workflows.description: Fork a Organization Repository for a specified repository owner
workflows.name: Fork Organization Repository

workflows.description: Lists the Fork repositories for the specified organization.
workflows.name: List Fork Repositories

workflows.description: Creates a new repository for the authenticated user.
workflows.name: Create User Repository

workflows.description: Lists public repositories for the specified user. Note: For GitHub AE, this endpoint will list internal repositories for the specified user.
workflows.name: List User Repositories

workflows.description: Update a Personal Repository for a user,
workflows.name: Update Repository

workflows.description: Deleting a repository requires admin access.
workflows.name: Delete Repository

workflows.description: Retrieve the specified branch revision details.
workflows.name: Get Branch Revision

workflows.description: Create Branch
workflows.name: Create Branch

workflows.description: Merge Branch
workflows.name: Merge Branch

workflows.description: List Branches
workflows.name: List Branches

workflows.description: Sync a branch of a forked repository to keep it up-to-date with the upstream repository.
workflows.name: Fetch Upstream

workflows.description: Clone Repository
workflows.name: Clone Repository

workflows.description: Apply the changes to local repository which we have cloned
workflows.name: Apply Changes to Local Repository

arguments.title: GitHub: Apply Changes to Local Repository

routes.name: Start-> Apply Changes to Local Repository

workflows.description: Commit the changes to the specified repository
workflows.name: Push Repository

workflows.description: Create the pull request for the specified repository.
workflows.name: Create Pull Request

workflows.description: List the Review comments.
workflows.name: List Review Comments on a Pull Request

arguments.title: GitHub: List Review Comments on a Pull Request

steps.name: List Review Comments on a Pull Request

arguments.name: GitHub
arguments.operationTitle: List Review Comments on a Pull Request

routes.name: Start-> List Review Comments on a Pull Request

workflows.description: Pull request authors and repository owners and collaborators can request a pull request review from anyone with write access to the repository. Each requested reviewer will receive a notification asking them to review the pull request.
workflows.name: Add Reviewers for a Pull Request

arguments.title: GitHub: Add Reviewers for a Pull Request

steps.name: Add Reviewers for a Pull Request

arguments.name: GitHub
arguments.operationTitle: Add Reviewers for a Pull Request

routes.name: Start-> Add Reviewers for a Pull Request

workflows.description: This returns a list of releases, which does not include regular Git tags that have not been associated with a release. Information about published releases are available to everyone. Only users with push access will receive listings for draft releases.
workflows.name: List Releases

workflows.description: Users with push access to the repository can create a release.
workflows.name: Create Release

workflows.description: Lists the people that have starred the repository.
workflows.name: List Stargazers

workflows.description: Star a repository for the authenticated user
workflows.name: Star Repository

workflows.description: Lists the people watching the specified repository.
workflows.name: List Watchers

workflows.description: If you would like to watch a repository, set subscribed to true. If you would like to ignore notifications made within a repository, set ignored to true. If you would like to stop watching a repository, delete the repository's subscription completely.
workflows.name: Set Repository Subscription
